candidates.title: Grandparents to 'Get All Their Grandchildren Every Weekend'
candidates.content:
Claim:
President Obama passed a law requiring grandparents to pick up pick up their grandchildren every weekend.
On 27 October 2016, the web site React365 published a hoax news article, which reported that President Obama had passed a law that required grandparents to take care of their grandchildren every weekend:
Grandparents must pickup up all their grandchildren every weekend no matter what or they will be fined 5000$ or 35 days in jail pickup must start this Friday and if not parents must call the local police station..
There is no truth to the story quoted here. React365 is a "prank" web site that does not publish factual stories:
This website is an entertainment website, news are created by users. These are humourous news, fantasy, fictional, that should not be seriously taken or as a source of information.
The content on React 365 is generated by users. After clicking the "create a joke" button, people are taken to a screen to fill out a fake news template. The web site generates the hoax news story and then encourages you to share it with your friends on social media in order to "prank" them:
There is, of course, no law mandating that grandparents have to see their grandchildren.
candidates.description: Reports that President Obama had passed a law requiring grandparents to "pick up" their grandchildren every weekend came from a site that generates user-created hoax news.

result.explanation: The claim that President Obama passed a law requiring grandparents to get all their grandchildren every weekend is explicitly debunked by the provided evidence. Snopes, a reputable fact-checking website, identifies the claim as a hoax originating from a user-generated prank website (React365).  The evidence directly states that there is no such law.
result.supporting_points: Source 1 from Snopes.com explicitly labels the claim as a hoax and states that there is no law mandating grandparents see their grandchildren every weekend.

final_result.explanation:
Both the internal and external validation checks strongly indicate that the original caption, "President Obama passed a law requiring Grandparents to Get All Their Grandchildren Every Weekend," is entirely out of context with the provided image. 

The internal check achieves a confidence score of 1, definitively stating that the caption's content is unrelated to the image. The image depicts grandparents interacting with a baby, a scene wholly inconsistent with the caption's assertion of a presidential law mandating weekend grandchild visits.  The lack of any connection between the visual content and the caption's claim forms the basis for this high-confidence assessment.

The external check further reinforces this conclusion with a confidence score of 10.  It cites Snopes.com, a reputable fact-checking website, as its source. Snopes explicitly debunks the claim about President Obama enacting such a law, identifying it as a hoax originating from a user-generated prank website. The external check's strong confidence stems from the authoritative nature of Snopes and its direct refutation of the caption's factual claim.  The external evidence conclusively establishes the falsehood of the caption's statement.

There is perfect alignment between the internal and external validation results. Both checks independently and decisively conclude that the caption is out of context.  The high confidence scores from both checks, 1 and 10 respectively, converge to produce an overall confidence score of 10, reflecting the overwhelming evidence against the caption's accuracy in relation to the image. No discrepancies or conflicts exist between the internal and external checks. The entity analysis, which focuses on the absence of any connection between the image content (grandparents and a baby) and the caption's content (a false claim about a law), completely supports the conclusion that the caption is out of context.  The lack of ambiguity and the strong supporting evidence lead to a clear and definitive assessment of the caption's out-of-context nature.
final_result.validation_summary: Both internal and external validation checks strongly support the conclusion that the caption is out of context.  The internal check identifies a complete lack of thematic connection between image and caption, while the external check uses a reputable fact-checking website to debunk the claim made in the caption.
